revised_title: Discovery of Flint Implements in the Pliocene Age
tldr: The author discusses the discovery of a new type of flint implements found below the base of the Red Crag in Suffolk, proving the existence of skilled workers of flint in the Pliocene age. These implements were found in association with bones and other artifacts, suggesting that the area was once inhabited by prehistoric humans. The discovery challenges previous ideas about the antiquity of human tools and the knowledge of flint chipping.
